title: SEO, Analytics & Comments Integration
description: Implement comprehensive SEO with Schema.org markup, OpenGraph tags, XML sitemaps, robots.txt, integrate Giscus comments with async loading, and add simple Vercel Analytics for page views.

stories.title: Implement Schema.org JSON-LD structured data
acceptance_criteria: BlogPosting schema for individual post pages
Person schema for author (Dakota Smith)
WebSite schema for homepage
BreadcrumbList schema for navigation hierarchy
JSON-LD script tags injected in page head
stories.apl_goal: Create Schema.org JSON-LD generators for BlogPosting, Person, WebSite, and BreadcrumbList, inject structured data into appropriate pages, and validate with Google Rich Results Test
technical_notes: Use next/head or script tag in layout/page components
Include author, datePublished, dateModified, image, headline
Validate with schema.org validator and Google Rich Results Test

stories.title: Generate dynamic OpenGraph images for posts
acceptance_criteria: OpenGraph image generator using @vercel/og or next/og
Dynamic OG images include post title, date, and branding
Images generated at build time and cached
Fallback to default OG image for pages without custom image
Images are 1200x630px (recommended size)
stories.apl_goal: Implement dynamic OpenGraph image generation using @vercel/og, create template with post title and metadata, generate images at build time for all posts, and configure proper og:image meta tags
technical_notes: Use ImageResponse API from @vercel/og
Template should match neo-brutalist design
Generate images in /api/og route or at build time

stories.title: Create XML sitemap and robots.txt
acceptance_criteria: Dynamic XML sitemap at /sitemap.xml with all posts and pages
Sitemap includes lastmod, changefreq, and priority
robots.txt allows all crawlers and references sitemap
Sitemap registered in Vercel deployment configuration
Sitemap validates against XML schema
stories.apl_goal: Generate dynamic XML sitemap including all posts, pages, and tag pages with proper metadata, create robots.txt allowing all crawlers, and configure Vercel headers for proper content-type
technical_notes: Use Next.js Route Handlers (app/sitemap.xml/route.ts)
Set lastmod to post's updated date or published date
Priority: 1.0 for homepage, 0.8 for posts, 0.6 for tags

stories.title: Integrate Giscus with async loading
acceptance_criteria: Giscus component created with GitHub Discussions backend
Comments load asynchronously using IntersectionObserver
Loading only triggers when user scrolls to comments section
Dark theme configured matching site design
GitHub repository configured with Discussions enabled
stories.apl_goal: Create Giscus component with IntersectionObserver-based lazy loading, configure GitHub Discussions backend, apply dark theme matching neo-brutalist palette, and add to post pages
technical_notes: Use @giscus/react package
Load script only when comments section is 200px from viewport
Configure repo, repoId, category, and categoryId from GitHub
Theme: custom CSS or use 'dark' preset

stories.title: Install Vercel Analytics for page views
acceptance_criteria: @vercel/analytics package installed
Analytics component added to root layout
Page views tracked automatically
No cookies used (privacy-friendly)
Analytics dashboard accessible in Vercel project settings
stories.apl_goal: Install @vercel/analytics, add Analytics component to app layout, verify page view tracking works, and ensure no cookies are set (privacy-compliant)
technical_notes: Import and render <Analytics /> in app/layout.tsx
Vercel Analytics is GDPR-compliant and cookie-free
Data retention follows Vercel's default policies

stories.title: Create simple analytics dashboard page (optional)
acceptance_criteria: Admin dashboard page at /dashboard (optional)
Display top 10 posts by page views
Show total page views and visitor count
Protected by environment variable or simple auth
Data fetched from Vercel Analytics API
stories.apl_goal: Create optional analytics dashboard page that displays top posts and visitor metrics from Vercel Analytics API, with simple environment-based access control
technical_notes: Use Vercel Analytics API (requires API token)
Environment variable for access: ANALYTICS_ENABLED=true
Display data in simple table or chart
This story can be skipped if not needed for MVP

architectural_decisions: Schema.org JSON-LD for structured data (better than microdata)
Giscus for comments (GitHub Discussions backend, no database needed)
Vercel Analytics for privacy-friendly, cookie-free analytics
XML sitemap generated dynamically at build time
